required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: the Association Between Obesity and Early Puberty
clinical_study.official_title: Polymorphisms in Obesity-related Genes Are Associated With Risk of Early Puberty in Han Chinese Girls

lead_sponsor.agency: Shenzhen Center for Disease Control and Prevention

clinical_study.source: Shenzhen Center for Disease Control and Prevention

brief_summary.textblock: childhood obesity and early puberty are closely related, but existing reports usually focus on their relationship from the perspective of phenotype. This study was designed to investigate the association between obesity-related genic polymorphisms and the risk of early puberty in Chinese Han girls.

detailed_description.textblock: the genotypes of obesity-related SNPs were determined and the unstimulated luteinizing hormone, follicle stimulating hormone and estradiol levels were also detected.

primary_outcome.measure: genotypes of SNPs in the obesity-related genes
primary_outcome.description: the obesity-related SNPs in the LRRN6C, MAF, CYP27A1 and ETV5 genes are selected and the genotypes of these SNPs are determined with a MassARRAY system.

arm_group.description: early puberty girls of Han Chinese
normal development girls of Han Chinese

study_pop.textblock: Chinese Han girls from Shenzhen Children's Hospital or monitoring schools in Shenzhen

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of central precocious puberty or early and fast puberty.
Exclusion Criteria:
- The participants who were not the first visit to the hospital and had been treated before.
- The participants who were with endocrine disorders.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Shenzhen Center for Disease Control and Prevention
